   23: %% Purpose:
   24: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   25: -module(snmp_conf_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: %% Include files
   29: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -include("snmp_test_lib.hrl").
   34: 
   35: -include_lib("snmp/include/STANDARD-MIB.hrl").
   36: -include_lib("snmp/include/OTP-SNMPEA-MIB.hrl").
   37: 
   38: 
   39: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   40: %% External exports
   41: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   42: -export([
   43:          suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   44:          init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   45:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2, 
   46:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   47: 
   48: 	 check_mandatory/1,
   49: 	 check_integer1/1,
   50: 	 check_integer2/1,
   51: 	 check_string1/1,
   52: 	 check_string2/1,
   53: 	 check_atom/1,
   54: 	 check_ip/1,
   55: 	 check_taddress/1,
   56: 	 check_packet_size/1,
   57: 	 check_oid/1,
   58: 	 check_sec_model1/1,
   59: 	 check_sec_model2/1,
   60: 	 check_sec_level/1,
   61: 	 check_timer/1,
   62: 
   63: 	 read/1,
   64: 	 read_files/1,
   65: 
   66:          fd_leak_check/1
   67: 	]).
   68: 
   69: 
   70: %%======================================================================
   71: %% Common Test interface functions
   72: %%======================================================================
   73: 
   74: suite() -> 
   75:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]}].
   76: 
   77: all() -> 
   78:     [
   79:      check_mandatory,
   80:      check_integer1, check_integer2,
   81:      check_string1, check_string2,
   82:      check_atom,
   83:      check_ip,
   84:      check_taddress,
   85:      check_packet_size,
   86:      check_oid,
   87:      check_sec_model1,
   88:      check_sec_model2,
   89:      check_sec_level,
   90:      check_timer, 
   91:      read, read_files,
   92:      fd_leak_check
   93:     ].
   94: 
   95: groups() -> 
   96:     [].
   97: 
   98: 
   99: 
  100: %%
  101: %% -----
  102: %%
  103: 
  104: init_per_suite(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  105:     ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  106:             "~n      Config0: ~p", [Config0]),
  107: 
  108:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  109:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  110:             SKIP;
  111: 
  112:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  113:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  114:             snmp_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  115: 
  116:             PrivDir    = ?config(priv_dir, Config1),
  117:             PrivSubdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "snmp_conf_test"),
  118:             ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(PrivSubdir, "dummy")),
  119:             Config2 = [{priv_subdir, PrivSubdir} | Config1],
  120: 
  121:             ?IPRINT("init_per_suite -> end when"
  122:                     "~n      Config: ~p", [Config2]),
  123:             
  124:             Config2
  125:     end.
  126: 
  127: end_per_suite(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  128:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  129:             "~n      Config0: ~p", [Config0]),
  130: 
  131:     snmp_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  132:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  133: 
  134:     ?IPRINT("end_per_suite -> end"),
  135: 
  136:     Config1.
  137: 
  138: 
  139: 
  140: %%
  141: %% -----
  142: %%
  143: 
  144: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  145: 	Config.
  146: 
  147: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  148: 	Config.
  149: 
  150: 
  151: 
  152: %%
  153: %% -----
  154: %%
  155: 
  156: init_per_testcase(fd_leak_check = _Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  157:     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  158:             "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  159: 
  160:     %% There are other ways to test this:
  161:     %% lsof (linux and maybe FreeBSD):    lsof -p <pid>
  162:     %%    os:cmd("lsof -p " ++ os:getpid() ++ " | grep -v COMMAND | wc -l").
  163:     %% fstat (FreeBSD, OpenBSD and maybe NetBSD): fstat -p <pid>
  164:     %%    os:cmd("fstat -p " ++ os:getpid() ++ " | grep -v USER | wc -l").
  165:     %% But this (list:dir) is good enough...
  166:     case os:type() of
  167:         {unix, linux} ->
  168:             ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> linux: check proc fs"),
  169:             case file:read_file_info("/proc/" ++ os:getpid() ++ "/fd") of
  170:                 {ok, #file_info{type   = directory,
  171:                                 access = Access}}
  172:                   when (Access =:= read) orelse
  173:                        (Access =:= read_write) ->
  174:                     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> linux: usingh proc fs"),
  175:                     [{num_open_fd, fun num_open_fd_using_list_dir/0} |
  176:                      Config];
  177:                 _ ->
  178:                     {skip, "Not proc fd"}
  179:             end;
  180:         {unix, solaris} ->
  181:             %% Something strange happens when we use pfiles from within erlang,
  182:             %% so skip the test for now
  183: 
  184:             %% For some reason even though 'which' exists (at least in
  185:             %% a tcsh shell), it hangs when called via os:cmd/1.
  186:             %% And type produces results that is not so easy to
  187:             %% "analyze". So, we 'try it' and know that it starts 
  188:             %% by writing the pid and program on the first line...
  189: 
  190:             %% ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> solaris: check pfiles"),
  191:             %% PID = os:getpid(),
  192:             %% case string:find(os:cmd("pfiles -n " ++ PID), PID) of
  193:             %%     nomatch ->
  194:             %%         {skip, "pfiles not found"};
  195:             %%     _ ->
  196:             %%         ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> solaris: pfiles found"),
  197:             %%         [{num_open_fd, fun num_open_fd_using_pfiles/0} |
  198:             %%          Config]
  199:             %% end;
  200:             {skip, "pfiles not found"};
  201: 
  202:         {unix, BSD} when (BSD =:= freebsd) orelse
  203:                          (BSD =:= openbsd) orelse
  204:                          (BSD =:= netbsd) ->
  205:             ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> ~w: check fstat", [BSD]),
  206:             case os:cmd("which fstat") of
  207:                 [] ->
  208:                     {skip, "fstat not found"};
  209:                 _ ->
  210:                     ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> ~w: fstat found", [BSD]),
  211:                     [{num_open_fd, fun num_open_fd_using_fstat/0} |
  212:                      Config]
  213:             end;
  214:         {win32, _} ->
  215:             ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> windows: no check"),
  216:             {skip, "Not implemented"};
  217:         _ ->
  218:             ?IPRINT("init_per_testcase -> no check"),
  219:             {skip, "Not implemented"}
  220:     end;
  221: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     Config.
  226: 
  227: 
  228: 
  229: %%======================================================================
  230: %% Test functions
  231: %%======================================================================
  232: 
  233: check_mandatory(suite) -> [];
  234: check_mandatory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     ?P(check_mandatory),
  236:     %% ?IPRINT("check_mandatory -> entry"),
  237:     A1 = [{a, hej}, {b, hopp}, {c, 10}, {d, 10101}, {f, 10.88}],
  238:     B1 = [{a, {value, hejsan}}, 
  239: 	  {b, mandatory}, 
  240: 	  {d, {value, 20202}}, 
  241: 	  {e, {value, "kalle"}}],
  242:     {ok, _L1} = verify_mandatory(A1, B1),
  243:     ?DBG("check_mandatory -> L1: ~p", [L1]),
  244:     A2 = [{a, hej}, {c, 10}, {d, 10101}, {f, 10.88}],
  245:     B2 = [{a, {value, hejsan}}, 
  246: 	  {b, mandatory}, 
  247: 	  {d, {value, 20202}}, 
  248: 	  {e, {value, "kalle"}}],
  249:     ok = verify_not_mandatory(A2, B2),
  250:     ok.
  251: 
  252: verify_mandatory(A, B) ->
  253:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_mandatory(A, B)) of
  254: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  255: 	    ?FAIL({mandatory_fail, A, B, Reason});
  256: 	{ok, A} ->
  257: 	    ?FAIL({mandatory_not_updated, A, B});
  258: 	{ok, L} when A /= L ->
  259: 	    verify_mandatory2(B, L)
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: verify_mandatory2([], L) ->
  263:     {ok, L};
  264: verify_mandatory2([{Key, _}|T], L) ->
  265:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, L) of
  266: 	false ->
  267: 	    ?FAIL({missing_key, Key, L});
  268: 	{value, _} ->
  269: 	    verify_mandatory2(T, L)
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: verify_not_mandatory(A, B) ->
  273:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_mandatory(A, B)) of
  274: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  275: 	    ok;
  276: 	Else ->
  277: 	    ?FAIL({mandatory_not_fail, Else})
  278:     end.
  279: 
  280: 
  281: %%======================================================================
  282: 
  283: check_integer1(suite) -> [];
  284: check_integer1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     ?P(check_integer1),
  286:     ok = verify_int(0),
  287:     ok = verify_int(16#FF),
  288:     ok = verify_int(16#FFFF),
  289:     ok = verify_int(16#FFFFFFFF),
  290:     ok = verify_int(-1),
  291:     ok = verify_int(-333),
  292: 
  293:     ok = verify_not_int("kalle & hobbe"),
  294:     ok = verify_not_int(kalle_och_hobbe),
  295:     ok = verify_not_int(1.5),
  296: 
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: verify_int(Val) ->
  300:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_integer(Val)) of
  301: 	{error, Reason} ->
  302: 	    ?FAIL({verify_int, Val, Reason});
  303: 	ok ->
  304: 	    ok
  305:     end.
  306: 
  307: verify_not_int(Val) ->
  308:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_integer(Val)) of
  309: 	ok ->
  310: 	    ?FAIL({verify_int, Val});
  311: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  312: 	    ok
  313:     end.
  314: 
  315: %%======================================================================
  316: 
  317: check_integer2(suite) -> [];
  318: check_integer2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     ?P(check_integer2),
  320: 
  321:     ok = verify_int(0,      any),
  322:     ok = verify_int(-22222, any),
  323:     ok = verify_int(33333,  any),
  324:     ok = verify_int(1,      pos),
  325:     ok = verify_int(9999,   pos),
  326:     ok = verify_int(-1,     neg),
  327:     ok = verify_int(-9999,  neg),
  328:     ok = verify_int(1,      {gt, 0}),
  329:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {gt, -255}),
  330:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {gte, -255}),
  331:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {gte, 88888}),
  332:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {lt,  88889}),
  333:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {lte, 88888}),
  334:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {eq,  88888}),
  335:     ok = verify_int(88888,  {range, 88887,88889}),
  336: 
  337:     ok = verify_not_int("kalle & hobbe", any),
  338:     ok = verify_not_int(kalle_och_hobbe, any),
  339:     ok = verify_not_int(1.5,             any),
  340: 
  341:     ok = verify_not_int(0,      pos),
  342:     ok = verify_not_int(-22222, pos),
  343:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  neg),
  344:     ok = verify_not_int(0,      {gt,  0}),
  345:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gt,  99999}),
  346:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gt,  33333}),
  347:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gte, 33334}),
  348:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {lt,  33333}),
  349:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {lte, 33332}),
  350:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {eq,  33332}),
  351:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {eq,  -33333}),
  352:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {range, 33334, 33338}),
  353:     ok = verify_not_int(33339,  {range, 33334, 33338}),
  354:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gt,  kalle}),
  355:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gt,  1.55}),
  356:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {gte, "hejsan"}),
  357:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {lt,  hobbe}),
  358:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {lte, 1.7666}),
  359:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {eq,  33333.0}),
  360:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {eq,  -33333.0}),
  361:     ok = verify_not_int(33333,  {range, kalle, 33338}),
  362:     ok = verify_not_int(33339,  {range, 33334, kalle}),
  363:     ok = verify_not_int(33339,  {kalle, 33334, kalle}),
  364: 
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: verify_int(Val, Cond) ->
  368:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_integer(Val, Cond)) of
  369: 	{error, Reason} ->
  370: 	    ?FAIL({verify_int, Val, Cond, Reason});
  371: 	ok ->
  372: 	    ok
  373:     end.
  374: 
  375: verify_not_int(Val, Cond) ->
  376:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_integer(Val, Cond)) of
  377: 	ok ->
  378: 	    ?FAIL({verify_int, Val, Cond});
  379: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  380: 	    ok
  381:     end.
  382: 
  383: %%======================================================================
  384: 
  385: check_string1(suite) -> [];
  386: check_string1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     ?P(check_string1),
  388:     ok = verify_string("kalle & hobbe"),
  389:     ok = verify_not_string(kalle_hobbe),
  390:     ok = verify_not_string(1000),
  391:     ok = verify_not_string(1.0),
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: verify_string(Val) ->
  395:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_string(Val)) of
  396: 	{error, Reason} ->
  397: 	    ?FAIL({verify_string, Val, Reason});
  398: 	ok ->
  399: 	    ok
  400:     end.
  401: 
  402: verify_not_string(Val) ->
  403:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_string(Val)) of
  404: 	ok ->
  405: 	    ?FAIL({verify_string, Val});
  406: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  407: 	    ok
  408:     end.
  409: 
  410: 
  411: %%======================================================================
  412: 
  413: check_string2(suite) -> [];
  414: check_string2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  415:     ?P(check_string2),
  416:     Str = "kalle & hobbe",
  417:     ok = verify_string(Str, any),
  418:     ok = verify_string(Str, {gt,  length(Str) - 1}),
  419:     ok = verify_string(Str, {gte, length(Str)}),
  420:     ok = verify_string(Str, {lt,  length(Str) + 1}),
  421:     ok = verify_string(Str, {lte, length(Str)}),
  422:     ok = verify_string(Str, length(Str)),
  423: 
  424:     ok = verify_not_string(kalle_hobbe, any),
  425:     ok = verify_not_string(1000, any),
  426:     ok = verify_not_string(1.0, any),
  427:     ok = verify_not_string(Str, {gt,  length(Str)}),
  428:     ok = verify_not_string(Str, {gte, length(Str) + 1}),
  429:     ok = verify_not_string(Str, {lt,  length(Str)}),
  430:     ok = verify_not_string(Str, {lte, length(Str) - 1}),
  431:     ok = verify_not_string(Str, length(Str) + 1),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: verify_string(Val, Limit) ->
  435:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_string(Val, Limit)) of
  436: 	{error, Reason} ->
  437: 	    ?FAIL({verify_string, Val, Limit, Reason});
  438: 	ok ->
  439: 	    ok
  440:     end.
  441:     
  442: verify_not_string(Val, Limit) ->
  443:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_string(Val, Limit)) of
  444: 	ok ->
  445: 	    ?FAIL({verify_string, Val, Limit});
  446: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  447: 	    ok
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: 
  451: %%======================================================================
  452: 
  453: check_atom(suite) -> [];
  454: check_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     ?P(check_atom),
  456:     Atoms = [{kalle, "kalle"}, {hobbe, "hobbe"}, {dummy, "dummy"}],
  457:     ok = verify_atom(kalle, Atoms),
  458:     ok = verify_not_atom(anka, Atoms),
  459:     ok = verify_not_atom("kalle", Atoms),
  460:     ok = verify_not_atom(1000, Atoms),
  461:     ok.
  462: 
  463: verify_atom(Val, Atoms) ->
  464:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_atom(Val, Atoms)) of
  465: 	{error, Reason} ->
  466: 	    ?FAIL({verify_atom, Val, Atoms, Reason});
  467: 	{ok, _} ->
  468: 	    ok
  469:     end.
  470: 
  471: verify_not_atom(Val, Atoms) ->
  472:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_atom(Val, Atoms)) of
  473: 	ok ->
  474: 	    ?FAIL({verify_atom, Val, Atoms});
  475: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  476: 	    ok
  477:     end.
  478: 
  479: 
  480: %%======================================================================
  481: 
  482: check_ip(suite) -> [];
  483: check_ip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     ?P(check_ip),
  485:     ok = verify_ip([1,2,3,4]),
  486:     ok = verify_not_ip([1,2,3]),
  487:     ok = verify_not_ip([1,2,3,4,5]),
  488:     ok = verify_not_ip(kalle),
  489:     ok = verify_not_ip(1000),
  490:     ok = verify_not_ip([1,2,3.0,4]),
  491:     ok = verify_not_ip([1,two,3,4]),
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: verify_ip(Val) ->
  495:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_ip(Val)) of
  496: 	{error, Reason} ->
  497: 	    ?FAIL({verify_ip, Val, Reason});
  498: 	{ok, _} ->
  499: 	    ok;
  500: 	ok ->
  501: 	    ok
  502:     end.
  503: 
  504: verify_not_ip(Val) ->
  505:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_ip(Val)) of
  506: 	ok ->
  507: 	    ?FAIL({verify_ip, Val});
  508: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  509: 	    ok
  510:     end.
  511: 
  512: 
  513: %%======================================================================
  514: 
  515: check_taddress(suite) -> [];
  516: check_taddress(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  517:     ?P(check_taddress),
  518:     ok = verify_taddress([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  519:     ok = verify_not_taddress([1,2,3,4,5]),
  520:     ok = verify_not_taddress([1,2,3,4,5,6,7]),
  521:     ok = verify_not_taddress(kalle),
  522:     ok = verify_not_taddress(1000),
  523:     ok = verify_not_taddress([1,2,3.0,4,5,6]),
  524:     ok = verify_not_taddress([1,two,3,4,5,6]),
  525:     ok.
  526: 
  527: verify_taddress(Val) ->
  528:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_taddress(snmpUDPDomain, Val)) of
  529: 	{error, Reason} ->
  530: 	    ?FAIL({verify_taddress, Val, Reason});
  531: 	ok ->
  532: 	    ok
  533:     end.
  534: 
  535: verify_not_taddress(Val) ->
  536:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_taddress(snmpUDPDomain, Val)) of
  537: 	ok ->
  538: 	    ?FAIL({verify_taddress, Val});
  539: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  540: 	    ok
  541:     end.
  542: 
  543: 
  544: %%======================================================================
  545: 
  546: check_packet_size(suite) -> [];
  547: check_packet_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     ?P(check_packet_size),
  549:     Min = 484,
  550:     Max = 2147483647,
  551:     ok = verify_packet_size(Min),
  552:     ok = verify_packet_size(2*Min),
  553:     ok = verify_packet_size(Max),
  554:     ok = verify_not_packet_size(Min-1),
  555:     ok = verify_not_packet_size(Max+1),
  556:     ok = verify_not_packet_size(kalle),
  557:     ok = verify_not_packet_size("kalle"),
  558:     ok = verify_not_packet_size(1.0),
  559:     ok = verify_not_packet_size(1.0*Max),
  560:     ok.
  561: 
  562: verify_packet_size(Val) ->
  563:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_packet_size(Val)) of
  564: 	{error, Reason} ->
  565: 	    ?FAIL({verify_packet_size, Val, Reason});
  566: 	ok ->
  567: 	    ok
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: verify_not_packet_size(Val) ->
  571:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_packet_size(Val)) of
  572: 	ok ->
  573: 	    ?FAIL({verify_packet_size, Val});
  574: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  575: 	    ok
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: 
  579: %%======================================================================
  580: 
  581: check_oid(suite) -> [];
  582: check_oid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  583:     ?P(check_oid),
  584:     [_,_|Rest] = ?otpSnmpeaModule,
  585:     ErrOid = [6,16|Rest],
  586:     ok = verify_oid(?system),
  587:     ok = verify_oid(?sysDescr_instance),
  588:     ok = verify_oid(?otpSnmpeaModule),
  589:     ok = verify_not_oid(kalle),
  590:     ok = verify_not_oid("kalle"),
  591:     ok = verify_not_oid(1000),
  592:     ok = verify_not_oid(1.0),
  593:     ok = verify_not_oid(ErrOid),
  594:     ok.
  595: 
  596: verify_oid(Val) ->
  597:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_oid(Val)) of
  598: 	{error, Reason} ->
  599: 	    ?FAIL({verify_oid, Val, Reason});
  600: 	ok ->
  601: 	    ok
  602:     end.
  603: 
  604: verify_not_oid(Val) ->
  605:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_oid(Val)) of
  606: 	ok ->
  607: 	    ?FAIL({verify_oid, Val});
  608: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  609: 	    ok
  610:     end.
  611: 
  612: 
  613: %%======================================================================
  614: 
  615: check_sec_model1(suite) -> [];
  616: check_sec_model1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617:     ?P(check_sec_model1),
  618:     Exclude1 = [],
  619:     Exclude2 = [v1],
  620:     Exclude3 = [v1,usm],
  621:     ok = verify_sec_model(any, Exclude1),
  622:     ok = verify_sec_model(v1,  Exclude1),
  623:     ok = verify_sec_model(v2c, Exclude1),
  624:     ok = verify_sec_model(usm, Exclude1),
  625:     ok = verify_sec_model(any, Exclude2),
  626:     ok = verify_sec_model(v2c, Exclude2),
  627:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v1, Exclude2),
  628:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v1, Exclude3),
  629:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(usm, Exclude3),
  630:     ok.
  631: 
  632: verify_sec_model(Val, Exclude) ->
  633:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_model(Val, Exclude)) of
  634: 	{error, Reason} ->
  635: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_model, Val, Reason});
  636: 	{ok, _} ->
  637: 	    ok
  638:     end.
  639: 
  640: verify_not_sec_model(Val, Exclude) ->
  641:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_model(Val, Exclude)) of
  642: 	{ok, Res} ->
  643: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_model, Val, Res});
  644: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  645: 	    ok
  646:     end.
  647: 
  648: 
  649: %%======================================================================
  650: 
  651: check_sec_model2(suite) -> [];
  652: check_sec_model2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  653:     ?P(check_sec_model2),
  654:     ok = verify_sec_model(v1,  v1,  []),
  655:     ok = verify_sec_model(v1,  v1,  [v2c]),
  656:     ok = verify_sec_model(v2c, v2c, []),
  657:     ok = verify_sec_model(v2c, v2c, [v1]),
  658:     ok = verify_sec_model(v3,  usm, []),
  659:     ok = verify_sec_model(v3,  usm, [v2c]),
  660:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v1,    v2c, []),
  661:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v1,    v3,  [v2c]),
  662:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v1,    v1,  [v1]),
  663:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v2c,   v1,  []),
  664:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v2c,   v3,  [v3]),
  665:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v2c,   v2c, [v2c]),
  666:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v3,    v1,  []),
  667:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v3,    v2c, [v1]),
  668:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(v3,    v3,  [v2c]),
  669:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(kalle, v3,  []),
  670:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(1000,  v3,  []),
  671:     ok = verify_not_sec_model(1.0,   v3,  []),
  672:     ok.
  673: 
  674: 
  675: verify_sec_model(M1, M2, Exclude) ->
  676:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_model(M1, M2, Exclude)) of
  677: 	{error, Reason} ->
  678: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_model, M1, M2, Reason});
  679: 	{ok, _} ->
  680: 	    ok
  681:     end.
  682: 
  683: verify_not_sec_model(M1, M2, Exclude) ->
  684:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_model(M1, M2, Exclude)) of
  685: 	{ok, Res} ->
  686: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_model, M1, M2, Res});
  687: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  688: 	    ok
  689:     end.
  690: 
  691: 
  692: %%======================================================================
  693: 
  694: check_sec_level(suite) -> [];
  695: check_sec_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  696:     ?P(check_sec_level),
  697:     ok = verify_sec_level(noAuthNoPriv),
  698:     ok = verify_sec_level(authNoPriv),
  699:     ok = verify_sec_level(authPriv),
  700:     ok = verify_not_sec_level(kalle),
  701:     ok = verify_not_sec_level("noAuthNoPriv"),
  702:     ok = verify_not_sec_level(1000),
  703:     ok = verify_not_sec_level(1.0),
  704:     ok.
  705: 
  706: 
  707: verify_sec_level(Val) ->
  708:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_level(Val)) of
  709: 	{error, Reason} ->
  710: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_level, Val, Reason});
  711: 	{ok, _} ->
  712: 	    ok;
  713: 	Error ->
  714: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_level, Val, Error})
  715:     end.
  716: 
  717: verify_not_sec_level(Val) ->
  718:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_sec_level(Val)) of
  719: 	{ok, Res} ->
  720: 	    ?FAIL({verify_sec_level, Val, Res});
  721: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  722: 	    ok;
  723: 	{'EXIT', _Reason} ->
  724: 	    ok
  725:     end.
  726: 
  727: 
  728: %%======================================================================
  729: 
  730: check_timer(suite) -> [];
  731: check_timer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  732:     ?P(check_timer),
  733:     ok = verify_timer(infinity),
  734:     ok = verify_timer(1),
  735:     ok = verify_timer(10),
  736:     ok = verify_timer(2147483647),
  737:     ok = verify_timer(2*2147483647),
  738:     ok = verify_timer({1,1,0,0}),
  739:     ok = verify_timer({10,10,10,10}),
  740:     ok = verify_timer({2147483647,2147483647,2147483647,2147483647}),
  741:     ok = verify_not_timer(ytinifni),
  742:     ok = verify_not_timer("ytinifni"),
  743:     ok = verify_not_timer(0),
  744:     ok = verify_not_timer(-10),
  745:     ok = verify_not_timer({0,1,0,0}),
  746:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,0,0,0}),
  747:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,-1,0}),
  748:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,0,-1}),
  749:     ok = verify_not_timer({1.0,1,0,0}),
  750:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1.0,0,0}),
  751:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,1.0,0}),
  752:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,0,1.0}),
  753:     ok = verify_not_timer({"1",1,0,0}),
  754:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,"1",0,0}),
  755:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,"0",0}),
  756:     ok = verify_not_timer({1,1,0,"0"}),
  757:     ok.
  758: 
  759: verify_timer(Val) ->
  760:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_timer(Val)) of
  761: 	{error, Reason} ->
  762: 	    ?FAIL({verify_timer, Val, Reason});
  763: 	{ok, _} ->
  764: 	    ok
  765:     end.
  766: 
  767: verify_not_timer(Val) ->
  768:     case (catch snmp_conf:check_timer(Val)) of
  769: 	{ok, Res} ->
  770: 	    ?FAIL({verify_timer, Val, Res});
  771: 	{error, _Reason} ->
  772: 	    ok
  773:     end.
  774: 
  775: 
  776: %%======================================================================
  777: 
  778: read(suite) -> [];
  779: read(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  780:     ?P(read),
  781:     ?SKIP(not_implemented_yet).
  782: 
  783: 
  784: %%======================================================================
  785: 
  786: read_files(suite) -> [];
  787: read_files(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  788:     ?P(read_files),
  789:     ?SKIP(not_implemented_yet).
  790: 
  791: 
  792: %%======================================================================
  793: 
  794: %% Since we need something to read, we also write.
  795: %% And we can just as well check then (after write) too...
  796: fd_leak_check(suite) -> [];
  797: fd_leak_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  798:     ?TC_TRY(fd_leak_check,
  799:             fun() -> ok end,
  800:             fun(_) -> do_fd_leak_check(Config) end,
  801:             fun(_) -> ok end).
  802: 
  803: do_fd_leak_check(Config) ->
  804:     Dir       = ?config(priv_subdir, Config),
  805:     NumOpenFD = ?config(num_open_fd, Config),
  806: 
  807:     %% Create "some" config
  808:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> create some config"),
  809:     Entries = [
  810:                snmpa_conf:agent_entry(intAgentIpAddress, {0,0,0,0}),
  811:                snmpa_conf:agent_entry(intAgentUDPPort, 161),
  812:                snmpa_conf:agent_entry(snmpEngineMaxMessageSize, 484),
  813:                snmpa_conf:agent_entry(snmpEngineID, "fooBarEI")
  814:               ],
  815: 
  816:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> get number of FD (before test)"),
  817:     NumFD01 = NumOpenFD(),
  818:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> before config write: ~w", [NumFD01]),
  819: 
  820:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> write config to file"),
  821:     ok = snmpa_conf:write_agent_config(Dir, Entries),
  822: 
  823:     NumFD02 = NumOpenFD(),
  824:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> (after write) before config read: ~w", [NumFD02]),
  825: 
  826:     {ok, _} = snmpa_conf:read_agent_config(Dir),
  827: 
  828: 
  829:     NumFD03 = NumOpenFD(),
  830:     ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> after config read: ~w", [NumFD03]),
  831:     if
  832:         (NumFD01 =:= NumFD02) andalso (NumFD02 =:= NumFD03) ->
  833:             ?IPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> fd leak check ok"),
  834:             ok;
  835:         true ->
  836:             ?EPRINT("do_fd_leak_check -> fd leak check failed: "
  837:                     "~n      Before write: ~w"
  838:                     "~n      Before read:  ~w"
  839:                     "~n      After read:   ~w", [NumFD01, NumFD02, NumFD03]),
  840:             ?FAIL({num_open_fd, NumFD01, NumFD02, NumFD03})
  841:     end.
  842: 
  843: 
  844: 
  845: %% There are other ways to test this:
  846: %% lsof (linux and maybe FreeBSD):    lsof -p <pid>
  847: %%    os:cmd("lsof -p " ++ os:getpid() ++ " | grep -v COMMAND | wc -l").
  848: %% fstat (FreeBSD and maybe OpenBSD): fstat -p <pid>
  849: %%    os:cmd("fstat -p " ++ os:getpid() ++ " | grep -v USER | wc -l").
  850: %% But this is good enough...
  851: num_open_fd_using_list_dir() ->
  852:     case file:list_dir("/proc/" ++ os:getpid() ++ "/fd") of
  853:         {ok, FDs} ->
  854:             length(FDs);
  855:         {error, Reason} ->
  856:             ?EPRINT("Failed listing proc fs (for fd): "
  857:                     "~n      Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
  858:             ?SKIP({failed_listing_fd, Reason})
  859:     end.
  860: 
  861: 
  862: %% num_open_fd_using_pfiles() ->
  863: %%     NumString = os:cmd("pfiles -n " ++ os:getpid() ++
  864: %%                            " | grep -v " ++ os:getpid() ++
  865: %%                            " | grep -v \"Current rlimit\" | wc -l"),
  866: %%     try list_to_integer(string:trim(NumString))
  867: %%     catch
  868: %%         C:E ->
  869: %%             ?EPRINT("Failed pfiles: "
  870: %%                     "~n      Error Class: ~p"
  871: %%                     "~n      Error:       ~p", [C, E]),
  872: %%             ?SKIP({failed_pfiles, C, E})
  873: %%     end.
  874: 
  875: 
  876: num_open_fd_using_fstat() ->
  877:     NumString = os:cmd("fstat -p " ++ os:getpid() ++
  878:                            " | grep -v MOUNT | wc -l"),
  879:     try list_to_integer(string:trim(NumString))
  880:     catch
  881:         C:E ->
  882:             ?EPRINT("Failed fstat: "
  883:                     "~n      Error Class: ~p"
  884:                     "~n      Error:       ~p", [C, E]),
  885:             ?SKIP({failed_fstat, C, E})
  886:     end.
  887: 
  888: 
  889: %%======================================================================
  890: %% Internal functions
  891: %%======================================================================
  892:
